member.summary: Emits a load opcode of the appropriate kind for the constant default value of a type, such as 0 for value types and null for reference types.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.Emitters.OpCodeUtil.EmitLoadIndirectOpCodeForType(System.Reflection.Emit.ILGenerator,System.Type)
member.summary: Emits a load indirect opcode of the appropriate type for a value or object reference. Pops a pointer off the evaluation stack, dereferences it and loads a value of the specified type.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.Emitters.OpCodeUtil.EmitStoreIndirectOpCodeForType(System.Reflection.Emit.ILGenerator,System.Type)
member.summary: Emits a store indirectopcode of the appropriate type for a value or object reference. Pops a value of the specified type and a pointer off the evaluation stack, and stores the value.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.AttributeDisassembler.InitializeConstructorArgs(System.Type,System.Attribute,System.Object[],System.Reflection.ParameterInfo[])
member.summary: Here we try to match a constructor argument to its value. Since we can't get the values from the assembly, we use some heuristics to get it. a/ we first try to match all the properties on the attributes by name (case insensitive) to the argument b/ if we fail we try to match them by property type, with some smarts about convertions (i,e: can use Guid for string).

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.AttributeDisassembler.ReplaceIfBetterMatch(System.Reflection.ParameterInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: We have the following rules here. Try to find a matching type, failing that, if the parameter is string, get the first property (under the assumption that we can convert it.

member.name: T:Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.INamingScope
member.summary: Represents the scope of uniquenes of names for types and their members

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.INamingScope.GetUniqueName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a unique name based on
member.param: Name suggested by the caller
member.returns: Unique name based on .
member.remarks: Implementers should provide name as closely resembling as possible. Generally if no collision occurs it is suggested to return suggested name, otherwise append sequential suffix. Implementers must return deterministic names, that is when is called twice with the same suggested name, the same returned name should be provided each time. Non-deterministic return values, like appending random suffices will break serialization of proxies.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.INamingScope.SafeSubScope
member.summary: Returns new, disposable naming scope. It is responsibilty of the caller to make sure that no naming collision with enclosing scope, or other subscopes is possible.
member.returns: New naming scope.

member.param: The name.
Type declaring the original event being overriten, or null.
The add method.
The remove method.
The attributes.

member.name: T:Castle.DynamicProxy.Generators.MethodFinder
member.summary: Returns the methods implemented by a type. Use this instead of Type.GetMethods() to work around a CLR issue where duplicate MethodInfos are returned by Type.GetMethods() after a token of a generic type's method was loaded.

member.name: T:Castle.DynamicProxy.Serialization.ProxyObjectReference
member.summary: Handles the deserialization of proxies.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.Serialization.ProxyObjectReference.ResetScope
member.summary: Resets the used for deserialization to a new scope.
member.remarks: This is useful for test cases.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.Serialization.ProxyObjectReference.SetScope(Castle.DynamicProxy.ModuleScope)
member.summary: Resets the used for deserialization to a given .
member.param: The scope to be used for deserialization.
member.remarks: By default, the deserialization process uses a different scope than the rest of the application, which can lead to multiple proxies being generated for the same type. By explicitly setting the deserialization scope to the application's scope, this can be avoided.

member.name: P:Castle.DynamicProxy.Serialization.ProxyObjectReference.ModuleScope
member.summary: Gets the used for deserialization.
member.value: As has no way of automatically determining the scope used by the application (and the application might use more than one scope at the same time), uses a dedicated scope instance for deserializing proxy types. This instance can be reset and set to a specific value via and .

member.name: T:Castle.DynamicProxy.Tokens.InvocationMethods
member.summary: Holds objects representing methods of class.

member.name: T:Castle.DynamicProxy.Tokens.SerializationInfoMethods
member.summary: Holds objects representing methods of class.

member.name: T:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyGenerationHook
member.summary: Used during the target type inspection process. Implementors have a chance to customize the proxy generation process.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyGenerationHook.ShouldInterceptMethod(System.Type,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Invoked by the generation process to determine if the specified method should be proxied.
member.param: The type which declares the given method.
The method to inspect.
member.returns: True if the given method should be proxied; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyGenerationHook.NonVirtualMemberNotification(System.Type,System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: Invoked by the generation process to notify that a member was not marked as virtual.
member.param: The type which declares the non-virtual member.
The non-virtual member.
member.remarks: Non-virtual members cannot be proxied. This method gives an opportunity to inspect any non-virtual member of a type that has been requested to be proxied, and if appropriate - throw an exception to notify the caller.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyGenerationHook.MethodsInspected
member.summary: Invoked by the generation process to notify that the whole process has completed.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.AttributeUtil.AddDisassembler``1(Castle.DynamicProxy.IAttributeDisassembler)
member.summary: Registers custom disassembler to handle disassembly of specified type of attributes.
member.param: Disassembler converting existing instances of Attributes to CustomAttributeBuilders
member.remarks: When disassembling an attribute Dynamic Proxy will first check if an custom disassembler has been registered to handle attributes of that type, and if none is found, it'll use the .

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.AttributeUtil.ShouldSkipAttributeReplication(System.Type)
member.summary: Attributes should be replicated if they are non-inheritable, but there are some special cases where the attributes means something to the CLR, where they should be skipped.

member.name: T:Castle.DynamicProxy.CacheMappingsAttribute
member.summary: Applied to the assemblies saved by in order to persist the cache data included in the persisted assembly.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyBuilder.CreateClassProxy(System.Type,Castle.DynamicProxy.ProxyGenerationOptions)
member.summary: Creates a proxy type for given , using provided.
member.param: The class type to proxy.
The proxy generation options.
member.returns: The generated proxy type.
member.exception: Thrown when is a generic type definition.

Thrown when is not public. Note that to avoid this exception, you can mark offending type internal, and define pointing to Castle Dynamic Proxy assembly, in assembly containing that type, if this is appropriate.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyBuilder.CreateClassProxy(System.Type,System.Type[],Castle.DynamicProxy.ProxyGenerationOptions)
member.summary: Creates a proxy type for given , implementing , using provided.
member.param: The class type to proxy.
Additional interface types to proxy.
The proxy generation options.
member.returns: The generated proxy type.
member.remarks: Implementers should return a proxy type for the specified class and interfaces. Additional interfaces should be only 'mark' interfaces, that is, they should work like interface proxy without target. (See method.)
member.exception: Thrown when or any of is a generic type definition.

Thrown when or any of is not public. Note that to avoid this exception, you can mark offending type internal, and define pointing to Castle Dynamic Proxy assembly, in assembly containing that type, if this is appropriate.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyBuilder.CreateClassProxyType(System.Type,System.Type[],Castle.DynamicProxy.ProxyGenerationOptions)
member.summary: Creates a proxy type for given , implementing , using provided.
member.param: The class type to proxy.
Additional interface types to proxy.
The proxy generation options.
member.returns: The generated proxy type.
member.remarks: Implementers should return a proxy type for the specified class and interfaces. Additional interfaces should be only 'mark' interfaces, that is, they should work like interface proxy without target. (See method.)
member.exception: Thrown when or any of is a generic type definition.

Thrown when or any of is not public. Note that to avoid this exception, you can mark offending type internal, and define pointing to Castle Dynamic Proxy assembly, in assembly containing that type, if this is appropriate.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyBuilder.CreateInterfaceProxyTypeWithTarget(System.Type,System.Type[],System.Type,Castle.DynamicProxy.ProxyGenerationOptions)
member.summary: Creates a proxy type that proxies calls to members on , implementing , using provided.
member.param: The interface type to proxy.
Additional interface types to proxy.
Type implementing on which calls to the interface members should be intercepted.
The proxy generation options.
member.returns: The generated proxy type.
member.remarks: Implementers should return a proxy type for the specified interface that 'proceeds' executions to the specified target. Additional interfaces should be only 'mark' interfaces, that is, they should work like interface proxy without target. (See method.)
member.exception: Thrown when or any of is a generic type definition.

Thrown when or any of is not public. Note that to avoid this exception, you can mark offending type internal, and define pointing to Castle Dynamic Proxy assembly, in assembly containing that type, if this is appropriate.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyBuilder.CreateInterfaceProxyTypeWithoutTarget(System.Type,System.Type[],Castle.DynamicProxy.ProxyGenerationOptions)
member.summary: Creates a proxy type for given that delegates all calls to the provided interceptors.
member.param: The interface type to proxy.
Additional interface types to proxy.
The proxy generation options.
member.returns: The generated proxy type.
member.remarks: Implementers should return a proxy type for the specified interface and additional interfaces that delegate all executions to the specified interceptors.
member.exception: Thrown when or any of is a generic type definition.

Thrown when or any of is not public. Note that to avoid this exception, you can mark offending type internal, and define pointing to Castle Dynamic Proxy assembly, in assembly containing that type, if this is appropriate.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.IProxyBuilder.CreateInterfaceProxyTypeWithTargetInterface(System.Type,System.Type[],Castle.DynamicProxy.ProxyGenerationOptions)
member.summary: Creates a proxy type for given and that delegates all calls to the provided interceptors and allows interceptors to switch the actual target of invocation.
member.param: The interface type to proxy.
Additional interface types to proxy.
The proxy generation options.
member.returns: The generated proxy type.
member.remarks: Implementers should return a proxy type for the specified interface(s) that delegate all executions to the specified interceptors and uses an instance of the interface as their targets (i.e. ), rather than a class. All classes should then implement interface, to allow interceptors to switch invocation target with instance of another type implementing called interface.
member.exception: Thrown when or any of is a generic type definition.

Thrown when or any of is not public. Note that to avoid this exception, you can mark offending type internal, and define pointing to Castle Dynamic Proxy assembly, in assembly containing that type, if this is appropriate.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.MixinData.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Object})
member.summary:
Because we need to cache the types based on the mixed in mixins, we do the following here: - Get all the mixin interfaces - Sort them by full name - Return them by position
The idea is to have reproducable behavior for the case that mixins are registered in different orders. This method is here because it is required

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.ModuleScope.SaveAssembly
member.summary: Saves the generated assembly with the name and directory information given when this instance was created (or with the and current directory if none was given).

remarks.para: This method stores the generated assembly in the directory passed as part of the module information specified when this instance was constructed (if any, else the current directory is used). If both a strong-named and a weak-named assembly have been generated, it will throw an exception; in this case, use the overload.
If this was created without indicating that the assembly should be saved, this method does nothing.

member.exception: Both a strong-named and a weak-named assembly have been generated.
member.returns: The path of the generated assembly file, or null if no file has been generated.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.ModuleScope.SaveAssembly(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the specified generated assembly with the name and directory information given when this instance was created (or with the and current directory if none was given).
member.param: True if the generated assembly with a strong name should be saved (see ); false if the generated assembly without a strong name should be saved (see .

remarks.para: This method stores the specified generated assembly in the directory passed as part of the module information specified when this instance was constructed (if any, else the current directory is used).
If this was created without indicating that the assembly should be saved, this method does nothing.

member.exception: No assembly has been generated that matches the parameter.
member.returns: The path of the generated assembly file, or null if no file has been generated.

member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.ModuleScope.LoadAssemblyIntoCache(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Loads the generated types from the given assembly into this 's cache.
member.param: The assembly to load types from. This assembly must have been saved via or , or it must have the manually applied.
member.remarks: This method can be used to load previously generated and persisted proxy types from disk into this scope's type cache, eg. in order to avoid the performance hit associated with proxy generation.

member.name: P:Castle.DynamicProxy.ModuleScope.Lock

Thrown when given is not an interface type.

member.remarks: This method generates new proxy type for each type of , which affects performance. If you don't want to proxy types differently depending on the type of the target use method. member.name: M:Castle.DynamicProxy.ProxyGenerator.CreateInterfaceProxyWithoutTarget``1(Castle.Core.Interceptor.IInterceptor)
member.summary: Creates proxy object intercepting calls to members of interface on target object generated at runtime with given .
member.typeparam: Type of the interface which will be proxied.
member.param: The interceptors called during the invocation of proxied methods.
member.returns: Object proxying calls to members of types on generated target object.
member.exception: Thrown when given array is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Thrown when given is not an interface type.
member.remarks: Since this method uses an empty-shell implementation of interfaces to proxy generated at runtime, the actual implementation of proxied methods must be provided by given implementations. They are responsible for setting return value (and out parameters) on proxied methods. It is also illegal for an interceptor to call , since there's no actual implementation to proceed with. As a result of that also at least one implementation must be provided. This method uses implementation to generate a proxy type. As such caller should expect any type of exception that given implementation may throw.
